channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Huge pavement gap - potential massive trip and fall hazard, 30th June
item.description:
Pavement slabs terribly misaligbed

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15-17, Charlotte Street, Fitzrovia, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish overflowing and all over floor, 30th June
item.description:
The rubbish hasn't been collected and is overflowing all over the floor. Foxes have ripped open the bins and there's now food with maggots on the floor and across the footpath to get to the bins. The bin itself has a broken wheel which needs to be repaired

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Springdale Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vsn, 30th June
item.description:
This van has been dumped, and has been in the same location for well over 3 weeks. Tyres flat and damage to side.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Olyffe Avenue, East Wickham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging trees, 30th June
item.description:
Trees along the side of property 19A St John’s Road Sidcup obstructing the pavement in Craybrooke Road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Craybrooke Road, Albany Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rusty old bike blocks footpath and hits vehicles, 30th June
item.description:
This bike has been abandoned for over year, missing parts and fully rusted, but locked to the post. It regularly falls over, blocking the footpath, not allowing prams or wheelchairs to go past. It also falls onto the road and scratches vehicles parked.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stevens Avenue, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 30th June
item.description:
Please can you removed this. This was reported more than two weeks ago and still has not been removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Azof Street, East Greenwich, London

item.title: Lithium Ion Battery requires safe disposal, 30th June
item.description:
Following an incident attended by LFB a Lithium Ion Battery that was in thermal runaway requires safe disposal. it is contained within a wheelie bin outside number 12 Alnwick Road submerged in water on the conclusion of the incident attended by us.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alnwick Road, Horn Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: People who don't live there are dumping rubbish, 30th June
item.description:
This level of rubbish is coming from people who do not live in Kingsworth close clearing out their cars/vans. An empty can here or there is common place unfortunately but this bush is consistently filled with litter of people who do not live there. Please clear the rubbish and either remove the bushes or install CCTV so that people can start being fined.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingsworth Close, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Building sannd on road, 30th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 44, Marlings Park Avenue, St Paul's Cray, London

item.title: Black bags of household refuse, 30th June
item.description:
Two black bags. One dumped 30m down Mayplace Lane and one inside the Bronze Age burial site.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mayplace Lane, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish left by residents, 30th June
item.description:
Residents of this estate constantly leave rubbish and fly tipping in this spot. It is spread by the wind, animals…. Not animals nor wind fault! Could Lewisham Council sort this out as it has gone long for as long as I have lived in the area. I did a study Of waste on that estate as part of my Masters, that was 13 years ago and it has not improved! This needs to be sorted on short and long term.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nash Road, Brockley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Martin Bowes Road, Well Hall, London

item.category: Fly-tip Medium - Up to medium size van load

item.title: Part waste collection Graham road on collection days, 30th June
item.description:
Hi Sebastian, I write again as it seems that some bins ate collected and some are not collected and because of that in the hottest of day walking down graham Road, there's a foul smell coming from residents bins. Not acceptable at all. Pls investigate
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Graham Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose paving slabs, 30th June
item.description:
Loose paving slabs underneath the scaffolding /hording next door to Tesco ( where the sewing centre used to be) its a hazard as as you walk through the natural light changes and and its difficult to see.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Welling High Street, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Massive pile of rubbish, end of Grove Lane, 30th June
item.description:
At the bottom of Grove Lane, next to/amongst the bike parking, there is a massive pile of rubbish - in sacks and strewn loose across the pavement. It's big enough to need a van, I think.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grove Lane, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet
